greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(-x) / f(-x^7) in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(1/4) * eta(q) / eta(q^7) in powers of q.
Given g.f. A(x), then B(q) = A(q^4) / q satisifes 0 = f(B(q), B(q^3)) where f(u, v) = (u - v^3) * (u^3 - v) - 3*u*v * (2 + u*v).
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (112 t)) = 7^(1/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A035985.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x] / QPochhammer[ x^7], {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) / eta(x^7 + A), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 01 2014
